snippet: A terrorism case in Manhattan had been seen as a potential test of the Obama administration’s strategy of interrogating terrorism suspects for both intelligence and law enforcement purposes.
abstract: Mohamed Ibrahim Ahmed pleads guilty in Federal District Court in Manhattan to conspiring to support a Somali terrorist group in 2009; Ahmed was taken into custody in Nigeria and later interrogated by separate groups of American officials; case had been seen as a potential test of the Obama administration's strategy of interrogating suspects for intelligence purposes without advising them of their rights.
lead_paragraph: A terrorism case in Manhattan had been seen as a potential test of the Obama administration’s strategy of interrogating terrorism suspects for both intelligence and law enforcement purposes.

headline.seo: Man Who Trained With Somalis Offers Guilty Plea, Ending Pivotal Case
headline.main: Man Offers Guilty Plea, Upending Terror Case
headline.print_headline: Man Offers Guilty Plea, Upending Terror Case
